subsection.name: 9.1 General Approach to Building Expressions
subsection.p: There is a very generic way to build any semantically valid Cayenne expression. Internally all expressions are categorized by the number of operands as unary, binary, and ternary. ExpressionFactory class provides a generic way to build an expression of any of the above types, based purely on expression semantics, not on their meaning.

ul.li:
public static Expression unaryExp(int type, Object operand)
Creates a single-operand expression.

public static Expression binaryExp(int type, Object leftOperand, Object rightOperand)
Creates an expression with two operands.

subsection.p: All three methods above will check whether the expression type parameter corresponds to the expression with the specified number of operands. If not, an ExpressionException is thrown. Expressions themselves can be other expression's operands. This allows to build complex expression trees.
subsection.panel: The API discussed below is rarely used directly. Instead ExpressionFactory provides a simplified type-safe API discussed in the following chapters.
